definition.text: Processes fetching data from the Internet are optimized for accesing a wide range of APIs available out there. The Dataset Type they use to store raw data is usually not the best one for data consumption within the system. For that reason Dataset Type conversions needs to be done.

paragraphs.text: The type of conversion currently implemented into the system are:
How to convert from one Dataset type to another
There are two ways to convert from one Dataset type to another.
Custom Code: Users can write code to handle the conversion in cases the standard converter is not available for the type of conversion needed.

Standard Converter: Use a standard converter to do the job. Currently there is only one Standard Converter and it works converting from One-Min-Daily Dataset type to Multi-Period-Daily and Multi-Period-Market Dataset types.

The Candles-Volumes indicator at the Master Data Mine converts One-Min candles and volumes into candles and volumes of 2 min, 3 min, 4 up to 24hs. To do this it runs a custom made algorithm that aggregates that information provided by the Exchange Raw Data Sensor Bot.
The reason this was implemented as custom code is because when it was needed there was no standard converter implemented and still this was not migrated to the currently existing one.

The Asset Metrics Indicator Bot, defined at the Messari Data Mine uses a Standard Converter from One-Min-Daily Dataset type to Multi-Period-Daily and Multi-Period-Market Dataset types. To use the converter, the bot's Process Definition nodes need to have at their config the framework of this converter.
To convert to Multi-Period-Daily, set the framework name like in this example:
To convert to Multi-Period-Market, set the framework name like in this example:

You will need the standar converter everytime you use the API Data Fetcher Bot to extract data from some Inernet API. The bot will usually save the data in a One-Min-Daily Dataset Type, and you will need to setup and Indicator Bot with two processes, in order to convert the One-Min-Daily Dataset Type into a Multi-PeriodDaily and a Multi-Period-Market Dataset Type.
